message_1: What is the product formed when propanoic acid reacts with sodium hydroxide? Write the balanced equation for the reaction and identify the functional group present in the product.
message_2:
When propanoic acid (C3H6O2) reacts with sodium hydroxide (NaOH), the product formed is sodium propanoate (C3H5O2Na) and water (H2O). This is an acid-base neutralization reaction. The balanced equation for the reaction is:

C3H6O2 + NaOH â†’ C3H5O2Na + H2O

The functional group present in the product, sodium propanoate, is the carboxylate ion (COO-) which is a deprotonated carboxylic acid (COOH) group.
